intro: Soehrensia formosa subsp. korethroides, commonly known as the Korean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia, particularly Korea and parts of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
